algorithms

Class Astar

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Astar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algo

    public class Astar
extends java.lang.Object
implements Algo
    Implementation of the A* algorithm with self-made data structures.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Astar(Vertex[][] map, int[] start, int[] goal, int heuristics, boolean diagonalMovement)
      Initializes the Astar so it is ready to run.
      Astar(Vertex[][] map, int[] start, int[] goal, int heuristics, boolean diagonalMovement, boolean utilitymode)
      Initializes the Astar in utilitymode, which finds the closest walkable vertex with Dijkstra.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Astar

        public Astar(Vertex[][] map,
     int[] start,
     int[] goal,
     int heuristics,
     boolean diagonalMovement)
        Initializes the Astar so it is ready to run.
        Parameters:
        map - The vertex matrix representation of the map used by this routing algorithm
        start - The starting point of the route, supplied in {y, x} format coordinate array
        goal - The end point of the route, supplied in {y, x} format coordinate array
        heuristics - desired heuristic, LosAlgoritmos.HEURISTICNAME
        diagonalMovement - true -> diagonalMovement is allowed, false -> denied

      • Astar

        public Astar(Vertex[][] map,
     int[] start,
     int[] goal,
     int heuristics,
     boolean diagonalMovement,
     boolean utilitymode)
        Initializes the Astar in utilitymode, which finds the closest walkable vertex with Dijkstra. Uses utilityStack to store changed vertices so their state can be reset.
        Parameters:
        map - The vertex matrix representation of the map used by this routing algorithm
        start - The starting point of the route, supplied in {y, x} format coordinate array
        goal - The end point of the route, supplied in {y, x} format coordinate array
        heuristics - desired heuristic, LosAlgoritmos.HEURISTICNAME
        diagonalMovement - true -> diagonalMovement is allowed, false -> denied
        utilitymode - true -> utilitymode ON.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public Stack<Vertex> run()
        Runs the Astar algorithm with the provided map, starting point and the goal. Saves all information to the Vertex objects on the map.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Algo
        Returns:
        the best route.

      • getUtilityStack

        public Stack<Vertex> getUtilityStack()
        UtilityStack contains all vertices that were processed during utilityMode. It is sufficient to reset only these vertices.
        Returns:
        utilityStack.
